records.content: A collection of prayers for those who study, teach, and practice the craft of computing.

This website offers prayers for every season, struggle, and celebration in the life of computer science students and professors. From the first day of class to defending a thesis, from debugging frustrating code to experiencing breakthrough moments, these prayers invite us to bring our whole selves before God.

The prayers are organized into 13 major categories:

The Rhythms of the Academic Year - Beginnings, middles, endings, and transitions

The Work of Learning - For students: intellectual struggle, breakthroughs, daily work, assessment

The Work of Teaching - For professors: preparation, classroom, mentorship, research

Collaboration & Community - Working together, academic community, mentorship

The Practice of Programming - Creation, debugging, testing, deployment

Moments of Struggle & Doubt - Personal challenges, failure, ethical struggles

Ethical & Vocational Formation - Wisdom, calling, character

Specific CS Domains - Core areas, specialized fields, mathematical foundations

Technology & Tools - Git, IDEs, infrastructure

Seasons & Daily Rhythms - Daily, weekly, and seasonal patterns

Relationships & Humanity - With students, professors, peers, family

The Life of the Mind - Wonder, limits, integration

Special Occasions - Celebrations, commemorations, lament

Node.js (v16 or higher)

npm
npm install

Start the development server:npm start

This will launch a local MyST server at http://localhost:3000

Build the static site:npm run build

The built site will be in the _build/html directory.
We welcome contributions! Each prayer page includes a link to submit a pull request directly on GitHub.

Navigate to the appropriate prayer file

Click the “Submit a pull request” link

Replace the placeholder text with your prayer

Submit your pull request for review

Prayers should be appropriate for both students and professors

Use inclusive language

Be honest about struggle and doubt

Root prayers in hope and the character of God

Consider the specific CS context

csprayers.com/
├── myst.yml              # MyST configuration
├── package.json          # Node dependencies
├── index.md              # Homepage
├── prayers.md            # Main prayer index
└── prayers/              # Prayer content
    ├── academic-year/
    ├── learning/
    ├── teaching/
    ├── collaboration/
    ├── programming/
    ├── struggle/
    ├── formation/
    ├── domains/
    ├── tools/
    ├── rhythms/
    ├── relationships/
    ├── mind/
    └── occasions/
MIT License - see LICENSE file for details
This project was inspired by the need for resources that integrate faith with the study and practice of computer science.
Welcome to a collection of prayers written for those who study, teach, and practice the craft of computing.

In the discipline of Computer Science, we encounter profound questions about logic, creation, beauty, and human flourishing. These prayers are offered as a resource for students and professors who wish to integrate their faith with their intellectual work.

Whether you’re starting a new semester, debugging stubborn code, wrestling with imposter syndrome, or preparing to teach a difficult concept, these prayers invite you to bring your whole self—mind, heart, and soul—before God.

Explore our collection of 

Sample Prayers, including:

A Prayer for the Beginning of a Semester - For professors and students as a new term begins

A Prayer Before Debugging - When the code will not run, and the error is hidden

A Prayer for the Student Facing Imposter Syndrome - When you feel you do not belong

A Prayer Before Teaching a Difficult Concept - For the professor preparing to explain what is hard

“The heavens declare the glory of God; the skies proclaim the work of his hands.”
— Psalm 19:1

“For from him and through him and for him are all things. To him be the glory forever! Amen.”
— Romans 11:36
